item.title: Notes from 2023
item.description: Some quick reflections on my 2023. All are personal, but the first three err on the side of the professional. I significantly improved my well-being this year compared to last by building more positive interactions into my basic lifestyle (e.g. walking to work, living with friendly flatmates, working in a social office). This is blindingly obvious, but you do need to seek those opportunities out as they aren’t a given. In the Civil Service, I usually worked from home three days out of five because my colleagues would go in two days a week – and 90% of a day in the office could be spent apart from colleagues due to hot-desking.

item.title: Why I Write
item.description: I wanted to set out my rationale for having a blog. George Orwell once gave four motives for writing, present in every writer in varying proportions: Sheer egoism. Aesthetic enthusiasm. Historical impulse. Political purpose. My current motivations are a mix of 1, 2, and 4. In my own words, I would codify them as: By the time I shuffle off this mortal coil, I would like to have some words on the record, regardless of the number of people who substantially care or remember them – though I obviously hope it will more than zero.

item.title: Not Consumer Surplus
item.description: Inspired by Consumer Surplus, I thought it would be fun to suggest some economical things that I think add significant value to my life. I know this is quite weird, but at the same time, I find it interesting to learn from other people’s experiences so I figured I might as well share my own. Personal finance is one case where I’ve definitely benefited from the research done by others.
